scene_target: Artie is locked into a 'Crit or Quit' build with 1 HP and 100% Critical Hit rate.
goal: Introduce Fizz and force Artie into a broken character build through a UI mishap and snarky dialogue.
conflict: Artie's cynical attempt to build a 'safe' character versus the System's glitchy, high-variance interface and Fizz's annoying guidance.
constraints: Timeline Lock: Artie must remain in the System Void; do not arrive at the tutorial zone.
Inventory: Artie must retain the Rusty Shortsword (Prop) in hand_right.
System Integration: Must display [System Notification] for the final stat allocation.
State Primacy: Artie's 1 HP status must be established as a hard constraint for the next scene.
end_condition: Artie's stats are finalized and the System Void begins to dissolve for transport.

last_scene: Artie met his System Guide, Fizz, in the flickering blue void of character creation.
A residual electrical surge from his death glitched the UI, dumping all his stat points into Critical Probability instead of Vitality.
The System finalized his build as a 'Glass Cannon' with 100% Crit and a precarious 1 HP before transport began.
key_events: Fizz introduced herself as the legally mandated System Guide.
Artie attempted to allocate 80 points into Vitality to become a 'tank'.
Residual electricity from the Snack-O-Matic caused a UI malfunction.
All 100 stat points were forced into Critical Probability and Multiplier.
The System assigned the 'Glass Cannon' trait and set Artie's HP to 1/1.
The System Void dissolved, beginning Artie's transport to the game world.
